title: Judge Rejects Trump’s Bid to Keep Papers Secret in Jan. 6 Inquiry
content: But a Trump lawyer has signaled an intent to appeal the ruling, which raises novel issues about an ex-president’s executive privilege powers.

title: At the Willard and the White House, the Jan. 6 Panel Widens Its Net
content: What went on at a five-star hotel near the White House the day before the riot could be a window into how a Trump-directed plot to upend the election ended in violence at the Capitol.

title: Trump Officials Illegally Campaigned While in Office, Watchdog Finds
content: Mr. Trump’s son-in-law and his chief of staff are among those accused of violating a law designed to prevent federal employees from abusing their power.

title: Moderna and U.S. at Odds Over Vaccine Patent Rights
content: Moderna’s patent application names several employees as the sole inventors of a crucial component of its coronavirus vaccine, excluding three government scientists.

more_info.byline: By Sheryl Gay Stolberg and Rebecca Robbins

title: Pfizer Asks F.D.A. to Expand Booster Eligibility to All Adults
content: In a turnaround, the agency is expected to grant the request before the winter holiday season, giving access to all 181 million fully vaccinated people.

title: N.F.L. Fines Aaron Rodgers and Packers for Violating Covid-19 Protocols
content: Rodgers, the Green Bay Packers quarterback who is not vaccinated and has voiced unfounded claims about Covid-19 vaccines, was penalized for not wearing a mask in some places.

title: G.E. Breaks Up With Its Storied Past
content: The company, once the epitome of corporate ambition, plans to split itself into three separate companies.

title: Oklahoma Supreme Court Throws Out $465 Million Opioid Ruling Against J.&J.
content: The 5-1 decision is a setback for those who are fighting to hold big drug makers accountable for the opioid epidemic.

title: Afghan Pilots Who Escaped Taliban Are Flown Out of Tajikistan
content: More than 140 Afghan Air Force pilots and crew members were evacuated to the United Arab Emirates three months after flying into Tajikistan to escape the Taliban.

title: Pakistan Reaches Cease-Fire With Resurgent Taliban Militants
content: The Pakistani government said it would offer amnesty for insurgents who are willing to disarm.

title: The 1619 Project and the Long Battle Over U.S. History
content: Fights over how we tell our national story go back more than a century — and have a great deal to teach us about our current divisions.

content: Scientists learned lessons from the 2018 outburst on the island of Hawaii that are changing how responders prepare for eruptions in other places.

content: From rap stardom to movie stardom, “Will” traces its hero’s quest out of West Philadelphia.

content: A Texas death row inmate, John H. Ramirez, asked the justices to let spiritual advisers pray with and lay hands on prisoners as they await execution.

title: Rivian prices its I.P.O., valuing the electric-vehicle maker at nearly $70 billion.

title: ‘We Had Their Baby, and They Had Our Baby’: Couple Sues Over Embryo ‘Mix-Up’
content: Daphna and Alexander Cardinale, the plaintiffs in a lawsuit against a Los Angeles-area fertility clinic, say they endured a painful custody exchange after DNA testing.

title: 6 Automakers and 30 Countries Say They’ll Phase Out Gasoline Car Sales
content: Ford, G.M. and Mercedes agreed to work toward selling only zero-emissions vehicles by 2040. But Toyota, Volkswagen and Nissan-Renault did not join the pledge.

title: Hospital Fire in India Leaves at Least 4 Infants Dead
content: The blaze, in a hospital in central India on Monday night, was the latest in a series of deadly fires at health care centers in recent months.

title: U.S. Holocaust Museum Says China ‘May Be Committing Genocide’ Against Uyghurs
content: Its report found that the government’s attacks against the group of Muslims in Xinjiang had escalated and most likely included “forced sterilization, sexual violence, enslavement, torture, and forcible transfer.”

title: Malala Yousafzai Is Married in England

title: Dean Stockwell, Child Actor Turned ‘Quantum Leap’ Star, Dies at 85
content: He appeared alongside Frank Sinatra and Gene Kelly when he was not yet 10. He later had signature roles in movies like “Married to the Mob” and “Blue Velvet.”

content: Physicians use a number of different factors to assess your risk of having a heart attack or stroke.

content: Differences in the way your body metabolizes drugs might render you prone to side effects.
